questions.question: What is the purpose of a strong password?
options: A. To make it easier to remember
B. To protect your accounts from unauthorized access
C. To share it with others for convenience
D. To make it shorter and simpler

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a strong password?
options: A. Contains personal information like your name or date of birth
B. Is a common word or phrase found in the dictionary
C. Uses a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols
D. Is the same password used for multiple accounts

questions.question: How often should you change your passwords?
options: A. Never, once set they can remain the same
B. Once a year or when there is a security breach
D. Every time you log in

questions.question: What is a recommended practice for managing passwords?
options: A. Use the same password for all your accounts
B. Write down your passwords and keep them in a secure location
C. Share your passwords with trusted friends or family members
D. Use a password manager to securely store and generate unique passwords
